author: KalleOlaviNiemitalo
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

When I use Set-Clipboard to copy a password to the clipboard on Windows, I would like a way to prevent the password from being stored to the clipboard history and the cloud clipboard.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Implement a `-Sensitive` option

```PowerShell
(Import-Clixml “password.xml”).GetNetworkCredential().Password | Set-Clipboard -Sensitive
```

and use the `ExcludeClipboardContentFromMonitorProcessing` clipboard format documented in [Cloud Clipboard and Clipboard History Formats](https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/win32/dataxchg/clipboard-formats#cloud-clipboard-and-clipboard-history-formats).

comments.author: KalleOlaviNiemitalo
comments.body: Need to test whether those clipboard formats also block clipboard interoperation across Remote Desktop connections. Such blocking might be desired in some cases but not in others. If some of those clipboard formats block Remote Desktop but others don't, then additional options (e.g. `-ClipboardHistory:$True -CloudClipboard:$False`) could be useful.

title: Set-Clipboard: Disable cloud clipboard and clipboard history for sensitive data
